diabetic-emergency.title: Diabetic Emergency
diabetic-emergency.subtitle: Hypoglycemia / Hyperglycemia
diabetic-emergency.about: Low or high blood sugar can cause serious complications. Quick recognition and action is important.
steps: Check blood sugar if glucometer available
If LOW sugar: Give sugar immediately (juice, candy, glucose tablets)
Have person sit or lie down
If HIGH sugar: Offer water, call doctor
Call 108 if unconscious or having seizure
dos: Give sugar for low blood sugar
donts: Don’t give unconscious person food or drink
Don’t assume intoxication — check medical ID

burn-emergency.title: Burn Emergency
burn-emergency.subtitle: Thermal Burns
burn-emergency.about: Serious burns require immediate cooling and medical attention to prevent complications and reduce damage.
recognize: Burns on face, hands, joints, or genitals
Deep burns with no pain (nerve damage)
steps: Cool burn with cool (not ice cold) running water for 10–20 minutes
Remove jewelry and tight clothing before swelling
Treat for shock — keep person warm and lying down
dos: Seek medical care for serious burns
donts: Don’t apply butter, oil, or ointments
Don’t give food or drink if severe

severe-bleeding-control.title: Severe Bleeding Control
severe-bleeding-control.subtitle: Hemorrhage
severe-bleeding-control.about: Severe bleeding can be life-threatening. Quick action to stop bleeding is crucial.
recognize: Bleeding that won’t stop after pressure
steps: Apply firm direct pressure to wound
If bleeding continues, add more layers
donts: Don’t release pressure to check bleeding

seizure-emergency.title: Seizure Emergency
seizure-emergency.subtitle: Epileptic Seizure
seizure-emergency.about: During a seizure, the person may shake, lose consciousness, or become confused.
steps: Move objects away to prevent injury
Call 108 if seizure lasts more than 5 minutes

heart-attack-emergency.title: Heart Attack Emergency
heart-attack-emergency.subtitle: Myocardial Infarction
heart-attack-emergency.about: A heart attack occurs when blood flow to the heart is blocked. Every second counts.
recognize: Pain in arm, jaw, or back

stroke-emergency-fast.title: Stroke Emergency (FAST)
stroke-emergency-fast.subtitle: Cerebrovascular Accident
stroke-emergency-fast.about: A stroke occurs when blood supply to the brain is interrupted. Time lost is brain lost.
steps: Do not give food or drink

cpr-cardiopulmonary-resuscitation.title: CPR (Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation)
cpr-cardiopulmonary-resuscitation.subtitle: Cardiac Arrest
cpr-cardiopulmonary-resuscitation.about: Immediate CPR can double or triple chances of survival.
steps: Push hard and fast in center of chest

choking-emergency.title: Choking Emergency
choking-emergency.subtitle: Airway Obstruction
choking-emergency.about: Quick action with Heimlich maneuver can save a life.

severe-allergic-reaction-anaphylaxis.title: Severe Allergic Reaction (Anaphylaxis)
severe-allergic-reaction-anaphylaxis.subtitle: Anaphylactic Shock
severe-allergic-reaction-anaphylaxis.about: Requires immediate epinephrine injection and emergency care.
steps: Lay person flat with legs raised
